While visiting the Blue city of Jodhpur, we were recommended to must try this place for Gulab jamuns.
This  shop is located in main city and is easily accessible. Got packet some of the Gulab jamuns and kalakand. There was an option of unsweetened  kalakand so decided to get that .
The place is clean and the sweets were fresh and delicious.
Tried those sweets at home and found them yummy. The gulab jamuns were different, as weren't dipped in sugar syrup and thus not excess sweet. They seemed so pure and yum.

had an extremely unpleasant visit to this shop. The staff were rude and unprofessional(‡§¨‡§¶‡§§‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§ú), using inappropriate language that made me feel unwelcome. Their behavior was shocking for a customer-facing business. Even worse, I noticed the staff handling food with unclean hands, which raised serious hygiene concerns. The overall atmosphere felt chaotic and uninviting due to their misconduct. I strongly urge management to address these issues, as they reflect poorly on the shop‚Äôs reputation. I won‚Äôt be returning and cannot recommend this place until significant improvements are made.

No one can beat the taste of the Kalakand and Gulab Jamun at this place‚Äîeach is truly unmatched anywhere in the world.
The Kalakand is perfectly soft and creamy, while the Gulab Jamun is incredibly rich and flavorful. Both sweets are a class apart and offer an unforgettable experience for anyone with a sweet tooth.
Highly recommended!

placeMetadata.name: Clock tower

sources.snippet: Around 200 years ago, Maharaja Sardar Singh of Jodhpur constructed the majestic clock tower known as the Ghanta Ghar in the heart of the city. This clock is manufactured by the same company that manufactured the clock tower in London. As the only clock tower in Rajasthan, it's a celebrated landmark marking the gateway to Old Jodhpur, often referred to as the clock tower of Rajasthan.
sources.shortName: 6 Unmissable monuments in Jodhpur and the history behind them

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Clock Tower is a historic landmark that stands tall in the heart of the city. It is an iconic symbol and a popular tourist attraction. Visitors can also learn about the history and significance of the Clock Tower through guided tours or informational plaques on site.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we‚Äôre always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Jodhpur, often referred to as the 'Blue City' for its stunning indigo-painted houses, is a treasure trove of architectural wonders that reflect its rich history and vibrant culture. From the majestic Mehrangarh Fort, which stands as a testament to the city‚Äôs royal past, to the intricately designed Jaswant Thada, Jodhpur offers a unique blend of ancient and contemporary architecture. As you wander through its bustling streets, you'll discover a variety of architectural firms that are redefining the skyline with innovative designs and sustainable practices, making the city a hub for both traditional craftsmanship and modern creativity.

At Wanderlog, we have a passion for uncovering the stories behind these remarkable structures and the talented architects who bring them to life. Whether you're exploring the historic Umaid Bhawan Palace or the beautifully restored Toorji Ka Jhalra Bavdi, Jodhpur's architectural landscape is as diverse as it is captivating. Join us as we delve into the best architectural gems in this enchanting city, showcasing a mix of renowned institutions, emerging hotspots, and hidden treasures that are sure to inspire your next visit.

data.title: The 29 best photo spots in Jodhpur

placeMetadata.name: Jaswant Thada

sources.snippet: Considered one of the most beautifully designed architectural landmarks of Jodhpur, Jaswant Thada is a well-equipped tourist destination to include in your Jodhpur tour package. Located next to the Mehrangarh Fort, the place is known for being an artistic wonder in the city that was built by Maharaja Sardar Singh of Jodhpur in the memory of his father Maharaja Jaswant Singh. Today, the site serves as a cremation ground for the royal Rajput families of Marwar.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places to Visit in Jodhpur (2021) in 2 Days

sources.snippet: Another brilliant example of India‚Äôs architectural wonders, Jaswant Thada sits beside a lake just a little away from the Mehrangarh Fort. This white marble monument, built in the 19 th century, commemorates the memory of Maharaja Jaswant Singh II who once ruled the city. You must visit this place in Jodhpur for its enchanting beauty, peaceful surroundings, scenic vistas, and for its extensive collection of paintings and portraits of Jodhpur rulers.
sources.shortName: 12 Tourist Places to Visit in Jodhpur 2024: Timings, Entry Fee

sources.snippet: Situated near Mehrangarh Fort, Jaswant Thada is a stunning marble cenotaph built to honor Maharaja Jaswant Singh II and set among serene gardens overlooking an inviting lake ‚Äî making for an idyllic photo location!. From taking shots of its intricate carvings and delicate lattice work to simply photographing its peaceful surroundings ‚Äî Jaswant Thada makes for the ideal setting to capture memorable photographs!
sources.shortName: Capturing Moments: Top Jodhpur Photo Places | by Rajwada Cab

sources.snippet: This intricately crafted cenotaph (empty commemorative tomb) was built in 1899 In honor of Maharaja Jaswant Singh II. It features white marble lattice screens and whimsical domes, while the inside is adorned with portraits of Rathore rulers. It's a peaceful place to relax and enjoy stunning views of the Fort and city. Many a tired tourist sprawls on the front lawn to recuperate after sightseeing.
sources.shortName: Top 13 Things to Do in Jodhpur, Rajasthan

sources.snippet: Jaswant Thada is a cenotaph that was built hundreds of years back in 1899. Back then, it would serve as a cremation ground for the royal family of Marwar, and now its grandeur and architecture attract locals and tourists alike. However, it is still not as popular as other spots on the list, which fortunately makes it not only a perfect instagrammable spot but also a peaceful spot.
sources.shortName: 10 Instagrammable Photo Spots at Jodhpur

sources.snippet: From the old town, it is a beautiful up-hill walk or quick rickshaw ride to the spectacular Jaswant Thada mausoleum. The white marble funerary monument was erected in the late 1800s to honor Maharaja Jaswant Singh II and was used as the cremation grounds for the royal Marwar family. Intricately carved inlays, known as jalis, are what make the structure so spectacular.

reviews.reviewText: Mandore Garden is truly one of the hidden gem of Jodhpur. This garden is is big and have lots of things to do within the premises. The garden premises consists of Cenotaphs, temples, museum, palace, recreation place, large mughal style water fountain and few amenities to cater to the tourists. The entrance fee per person is 40 bucks. The toilets can be much better in cleanliness. The museum inside has a separate entry fee of 20 bucks per head. Overall it will take around 2 to 3 hrs to explore this garden if one is a lover of art and architecture. This place even has a light and sound show in the evening for which one will have to pre book. This is situated at an outskirts of Jodhpur so one will really have to insist the driver to take there. Highly recommended!

The architecture here is unique ‚Äì tall red sandstone structures with intricate carvings that reflect the grandeur of Rajputana heritage.

The garden is also home to a museum, statues of deities and local heroes, and lots of monkeys roaming around, which adds a lively touch. It‚Äôs a good place for history lovers, photographers, and families looking for a relaxed outing.

Mehrangarh Fort is truly one of the most magnificent landmarks of Jodhpur. It is huge, beautiful, and steeped in history. A lift service is available (‚Çπ50 one-way) that takes you up to the higher levels of the fort, saving time and effort. From there, you still need to explore some sections on foot, especially to see the Diwan-e-Aam (Hall of Public Audience) and  Diwan-e-Khas (Hall of Private Audience).
One of the highlights of the fort is the breathtaking view of the Blue City of Jodhpur, best enjoyed from the top floors where the old cannons are placed. The panoramic view is truly mesmerizing, especially in the evening light.
It is highly recommended to hire a local guide. ( Rs.400 for 4 people )They explain the rich history, legends, and architectural details that you might otherwise miss. The fort also houses a well-maintained museum, which displays royal artifacts such as ancient swords, armory, traditional costumes, miniature paintings, palanquins, elephant seats (howdahs), and other treasures of Rajasthan‚Äôs royal heritage.
Mehrangarh is a must-visit attraction in Jodhpur, but do keep in mind that the fort is vast and requires time to explore properly. Plan to spend at least
2‚Äì3 hours here to cover the main sections comfortably.
If you have more time, you can also enjoy cultural performances and traditional music often held in the fort courtyard, which add to the royal experience.

The foundation stone of this majestic fort was laid by Rao Jodha in the mid-15 th century. Built over a period of 500 years, the fort bears testimony to the glorious era of the erstwhile ruling dynasty, and houses possibly the best museum in Rajasthan displaying paintings, arms and armoury, textiles, decorative arts and other prized exhibits.

Mehrangarh is a historic fort located in Jodhpur, Rajasthan, India. It stands on a hilltop, rising about 122 m (400 ft) above the surrounding plains, and the complex spans 1,200 acres (486 hectares). It was initially built around 1459 by the Rajput ruler of Rathore clan Rao Jodha,though most of the existing structure is from the 17th century built by his successors. The fort has seven gates, which includes main entrance Jai Pol (meaning 'victory gate'), built by Maharaja Man Singh to commemorate his victories over the Jaipur and Bikaner armies in 1806. The Fattehpol (lit.‚Äâ'victory gate'), commemorates victory of Maharaja Ajit Singh over the Mughals. The English writer and Nobel Prize winner, Rudyard Kipling, described the fort as "a palace that might have been built by Titans and colored by the morning sun."A beautiful magnificent fort with a magnificent history. Ancient lovely building with multiple floors. For the convenience of tourists a paid lift is installed. It takes you to the top most floor and then you can come down watching museum and temples along the way. Well maintained.
There is a museum and 3 to 4 temples inside. You need atleast an hour here. The ticket costs around 200 rupees The fort opens at around 9 am. There is a light & music show too here.
You can take a guide too. They are government certified as they say & charge around Rs 400 but you can negotiate to rs 200 to rs 250
Good place to visit. You feel in awe.
There are some decent food outlets outside

üìåAn Unforgettable Journey Through Time -
Stepping into Mehrangarh Fort in Jodhpur is not just visiting a monument; it's a profound journey back in time. Perched dramatically on a 400-foot-high cliff, this colossal fortress is a masterpiece of architecture, history, and culture that will leave you in awe. From the moment you approach its immense, towering walls, you understand why Rudyard Kipling called it "the work of giants."

The fort's exterior, carved from burnished red sandstone, seems to merge seamlessly with the rugged hill, creating an image of impregnable strength and natural beauty. But the true magic lies within. The intricately carved palaces, such as the stunning Moti Mahal, Phool Mahal, and Sheesh Mahal, are a testament to the opulence and artistic brilliance of the Rajput rulers. Each courtyard and room tells a story, beautifully preserved and brought to life by the excellent audio guide, which is highly recommended and well worth the minimal cost.

One of the most remarkable aspects of Mehrangarh is the incredible panoramic view it offers. From the ramparts, you can gaze out over the "Blue City" of Jodhpur, a sea of indigo houses that creates a mesmerizing contrast against the arid landscape. The feeling of standing at this vantage point, with the wind carrying the echoes of centuries of history, is simply breathtaking.

Magnificent fort with breathtaking views of Jodhpur‚Äôs Blue City. The museum is well-curated, showcasing royal artifacts, arms, and palanquins. Architecture is grand and well-preserved. Entry is a bit pricey, and it involves a lot of walking/climbing, but totally worth the experience.

"I'm still pinching myself after my stay at this Grand Hotel! From the moment I stepped into the lobby, I knew I was in for a treat. The staff were warm and welcoming, eager to make sure I had everything I needed. My room was spacious and beautifully subtle, with a comfy bed and stunning views of the city. The hotel's location was perfect too. If you're looking for a comfortable, luxurious, and genuinely welcoming place to stay, look no further than the this palace. I'll be back for sure!"

Amazing amazing hotel - they really give you royal treatment.  The staff is exceptionally attentive and go out of their way to make you feel special.  We got special treatment from, Sikander, Narayan and Khanchand.

A Royal Experience Like No Other ‚Äì Umaid Bhawan Palace is Pure Magic!

Staying at Umaid Bhawan Palace was nothing short of a dream come true. From the moment we arrived at this majestic sandstone marvel, we were transported into a world of regal opulence, impeccable hospitality, and timeless elegance.

The palace itself is a masterpiece‚Äîan architectural wonder blending Indo-Deco style with Rajput grandeur. Set amidst lush gardens and perched high above Jodhpur, the views of the Blue City and the Mehrangarh Fort are absolutely breathtaking.

What truly sets Umaid Bhawan apart is the warmth and professionalism of the staff. Every member of the team especially Mr. Gordhan Singh Ji, Mr. Sikander Singh Ji, Mr. Jabar Singh Ji, Mr. Sajjan Singh Ji, Mr. Karan Singh Ji, Mr. Hukum Singh Ji and Mr. Umaid Singh Ji made us feel like royalty. Their attention to detail, genuine smiles, and readiness to go the extra mile made our stay extraordinary.

Our Suite Room was spacious, beautifully furnished, and steeped in history, yet equipped with every modern comfort. The bed was luxurious, the bathroom was grand, and the heritage decor added a unique charm that made us feel like we were living in a bygone era.

Dining at the palace was a culinary delight. Each meal at Risala and Pillars was not just delicious, but also beautifully presented, with a menu that honored local Rajasthani flavors while offering international finesse.

We also thoroughly enjoyed the spa, the vintage car tour, and simply strolling through the manicured gardens. Every corner of the property tells a story, and the history is palpable in the best way.

Umaid Bhawan Palace is more than just a hotel‚Äîit‚Äôs an experience, a celebration of heritage, and a rare glimpse into a regal lifestyle that most only read about. Whether you're seeking luxury, romance, or cultural richness, this place delivers on every front. We left with hearts full of gratitude and memories to last a lifetime.

5 stars is simply not enough. Highly, highly recommended.

reviews.reviewText: Good for refreshment with friends and family on the outskirts of jodhpur. Camels ride, boating and zip lining are also available for refreshment.

Kaylana Lake, a serene man‚Äëmade oasis just 8‚ÄØkm west of Jodhpur, was built in 1872 by Maharaja Pratap Singh to alleviate water scarcity  . Covering about 0.84‚ÄØkm¬≤ and reaching depths of 35‚Äì50‚ÄØft, it sits nestled among rugged rock formations and babool trees, creating a striking contrast against the desert backdrop  .

Visitors often praise the lake for its peaceful ambiance and natural beauty. In winter (October‚ÄìMarch), it transforms into a paradise for bird watchers, welcoming migratory species like Siberian cranes, pelicans, herons, and flamingos  . Early mornings and evenings offer the best light, turning the water into a reflective canvas at sunrise and sunset  .

Recreational options are plentiful‚Äîboating is popular, with paddle, motor, and speed boats available (from around ‚Çπ120‚Äì‚Çπ250)  . Nature walks, trekking to a nearby Shiv Mandir, cycling, and picnicking by the shore add to the charm  .

Despite its appeal, amenities are sparse. Visitors note limited facilities‚Äîrestrooms can be locked or inaccessible, and there's a shortage of food stalls  . So pack essentials like water and snacks. Entry is free, and the lake is accessible daily, best enjoyed from 9‚ÄØAM to 5‚ÄØPM  .

Overall, Kaylana Lake is a peaceful retreat‚Äîideal for a 2‚Äì3‚Äëhour stop. It‚Äôs especially lovely during winter and monsoon when migratory birds take centre stage. Just don‚Äôt expect luxury‚Äîcome for the calm, wildlife sightings, and scenic views of Jodhpur‚Äôs desert landscape.

History -Kaylana Lake is located 8 km west of Jodhpur in Rajasthan, India. It is an artificial lake, built by Pratap Singh in 1872.
In ancient times this region had palaces and gardens made by two rulers of Jodhpur - Bhim Singh and Takhat Singh. These were destroyed to make Kaylana Lake.
Present - Very scenic and calm place specially if you are a sunset lover. Perfect for calm evening near lakeside with beautiful sunset views and boating.
Few camel rides are also available with some evening snacks to munch on. Welcome maintained these days.

Perfect place for a photo shoot specially your pre wedding shoot as the ambience is breathtaking specially during the sunset.

Must visit once.

This place is a little far from the city area and when I visited that time the lake had not enough water so you might be disappointed and also, this place does not have that much greenery and even the whole jodhpur city need some trees and gardens so many tourists can easily attract to visit. But yes this place is situated at a small height and you can also enjoy the sunset view from the small mountain area.
Had an awesome time with all the fun activities and a thrilling boat ride, not to mention the exhilarating zip line!
It is very hot during the day. The best time to visit this place is in the evening.

Kaylana Lake, located about 8 km west of Jodhpur, Rajasthan, is a stunning artificial lake that offers breathtaking views, serene surroundings, and exciting activities. Here's a detailed description:

Geography and Climate
- *Location*: Kaylana Lake is situated in the western part of Jodhpur, near the Kaylana village.
- *Size*: The lake covers an area of approximately 84 square kilometers.
- *Climate*: Jodhpur's climate is generally hot and dry, but the lake's surroundings offer a relatively cooler atmosphere.

Attractions and Activities
- *Boating*: Enjoy a relaxing boat ride on the lake, taking in the picturesque views of the surrounding landscape.
- *Birdwatching*: Kaylana Lake is a haven for bird enthusiasts, with over 100 species of migratory and resident birds.
- *Picnic*: The lake's serene surroundings make it an ideal spot for a family picnic or a romantic getaway.
- *Walking and Hiking*: Take a leisurely walk or hike around the lake, exploring the nearby hills and forests.

Flora and Fauna
- *Vegetation*: The lake's surroundings are dotted with acacia trees, scrub forests, and rocky outcrops.
- *Wildlife*: Kaylana Lake is home to various wildlife species, including deer

Balsamand Lake is a lake situated 5 kilometres (3.1 mi) from Jodhpur on Jodhpur-Mandore Road. This lake is a popular picnic spot, built in 1159 AD by Gurjara-Pratihara rulers. It was designed as a water reservoir to provide water to Mandore. The lake has a length of one kilometre (0.62 mi), breadth of 50 metres (160 ft) and a depth of 15 metres (49 ft).
The Balsamand Lake Palace was built later as a summer palace on its shore. The lake is surrounded by lush green gardens that house groves of trees like¬†mango,¬†papaya,¬†pomegranate,¬†guava¬†and¬†plum. Animals and birds like the jackal and peacock also call this place home.
Balsamand Lake is an artificial lake that was built way back in 1159 AD by Balak Rao Parihar as a water reservoir to cater for Mandore. One kilometre long, 50 m broad and 15 m deep; the lake is located in the middle of a manicured garden full of mango, papaya, pomegranate, guava and plum trees. Jackal and peacock are the prominent guests in the garden. There is an impressive red sandstone summer palace on the shores of the lake, which is now converted into a five-star property. Make a point to watch out for pesky monkeys when walking the nature trails. The area is a popular picnic spot for locals.

An Oasis of joy in the middle of a desert. Beautiful gardens, gorgeous rooms and a sense of being detached from time itself. A place that takes you away from it all and helps you to get to know someone that you had not really taken pains to know for some time....yourself.

This is a artificial lake built in 1159 AD by Balak Rao Parihar on. It is one of the  beautiful tourist places in Jodhpur . It was built to be used as a water reservoir for the people of city.

reviews.reviewText: The most hustling and bustling place in Jodhpur. Daytime you can dedicate for shopping from the tiny lanes dedicated for clothes, bangles and what not. In the midst of the lanes you would come across many savouries to devour.  Evening time you can stroll and look well lit clock tower and the fort presenting a great opportunity for photo enthusiasts. Standing near the clock tower you can imagine how well planned the cities would be in ancient times.

This historic clock tower was built in 1909 with a clock imported from London. It‚Äôs located right in the center of Sardar Market and serves as a prominent landmark.

I‚Äôve been visiting this area for over 10 years since my first trip, but unfortunately the dusty conditions remain unchanged. Every time a rickshaw passes by, clouds of dust still kick up from the unpaved roads, which can be quite uncomfortable.

While it‚Äôs possible to enter the clock tower itself, I didn‚Äôt find much merit in going inside, so I chose to skip visiting inside. The tower is impressive enough from the outside and worth seeing as part of exploring the bustling Sardar Market.

This monument built in the centre of the city, with tickets priced at 25/- per person is good to go. It provides good views of the mehergarh fort.

Historically it has been for hundreds of years, with the maintenance of the clock tower handed to a particular family down the generations.

Surrounding it is the sardar market, which is good for vegetables, spices, local handicrafts and general grocery items.

Good place to see the view from the top of clock tower. Also you can explore near by market and eat good local food

sources.shortName: 25 Best Places to Visit in Jodhpur Rajasthan

sources.snippet: Umaid Bhawan Palace was built by Maharaja Umaid Singh in 1929 to counter a famine which had hit the state at the time. It was also known as the Chittar Palace while being constructed thanks to the use of stones drawn from the Chittar hill. The palace was designed by HV Lanchester, a renowned British architect, and was completed in 16 years.
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Jodhpur, Attractions and Points of Interest- Rajasthan Tourism

sources.snippet: Magnificent Umaid Bhawan Palace, completed in 1944, was one of India's last grand palaces to be built. The royal family of Jodhpur still occupies a section of it. Most of the remainder has been converted into a luxurious palace hotel, and unfortunately, it's off-limits to anyone who's not staying there.

Sometime a room becomes so subtle that it hangs on a threat to be called as boring.  Felt the need of air conditioning at certain places but since, it‚Äôs a heritage property I understand that.  Morning, cold buffet was fine.  Overall, a good stay and there is everything for everyone.

Tucked away in the peaceful Cantt Area of Jodhpur, the Umaid Bhawan Palace isn‚Äôt just a hotel ‚Äî it‚Äôs a journey into India‚Äôs regal past. Standing tall on Chittar Hill, this golden sandstone masterpiece feels like a living dream crafted in marble, heritage, and timeless luxury.
One of the best new palace in rajsthan.. Looking real stone of jodhpur.. And how royal it was in days of jodhpur state kindom in power. You can imagine here in this palace

A Royal Experience Like No Other ‚Äì Umaid Bhawan Palace is Pure Magic!

Staying at Umaid Bhawan Palace was nothing short of a dream come true. From the moment we arrived at this majestic sandstone marvel, we were transported into a world of regal opulence, impeccable hospitality, and timeless elegance.

The palace itself is a masterpiece‚Äîan architectural wonder blending Indo-Deco style with Rajput grandeur. Set amidst lush gardens and perched high above Jodhpur, the views of the Blue City and the Mehrangarh Fort are absolutely breathtaking.

What truly sets Umaid Bhawan apart is the warmth and professionalism of the staff. Every member of the team especially Mr. Gordhan Singh Ji, Mr. Sikander Singh Ji, Mr. Jabar Singh Ji, Mr. Sajjan Singh Ji, Mr. Karan Singh Ji, Mr. Hukum Singh Ji and Mr. Umaid Singh Ji made us feel like royalty. Their attention to detail, genuine smiles, and readiness to go the extra mile made our stay extraordinary.

Our Suite Room was spacious, beautifully furnished, and steeped in history, yet equipped with every modern comfort. The bed was luxurious, the bathroom was grand, and the heritage decor added a unique charm that made us feel like we were living in a bygone era.

Dining at the palace was a culinary delight. Each meal at Risala and Pillars was not just delicious, but also beautifully presented, with a menu that honored local Rajasthani flavors while offering international finesse.

We also thoroughly enjoyed the spa, the vintage car tour, and simply strolling through the manicured gardens. Every corner of the property tells a story, and the history is palpable in the best way.

Umaid Bhawan Palace is more than just a hotel‚Äîit‚Äôs an experience, a celebration of heritage, and a rare glimpse into a regal lifestyle that most only read about. Whether you're seeking luxury, romance, or cultural richness, this place delivers on every front. We left with hearts full of gratitude and memories to last a lifetime.

5 stars is simply not enough. Highly, highly recommended.

It  is a stunning blend of heritage and luxury. One of the world's largest private residences, it is divided into a luxury hotel (Taj), a museum, and the royal family's home.

- Architecture: Built in golden sandstone, the palace showcases Indo-Art Deco style with grand courtyards, exquisite murals, and vintage decor.
- Luxury Stay:The Taj-operated hotel offers opulent rooms, impeccable service, and world-class amenities, including a spa and fine dining.
- Museum: Displays artifacts, clocks, and vintage cars, offering a glimpse into Jodhpur‚Äôs royal history.
- Views & Grounds: Breathtaking views of the Blue City and Mehrangarh Fort, along with lush gardens and a picturesque pool.
Expensive but worth it !!!

reviews.reviewText:
We had amazing day tour and hospitality by OM ji and Shamburam ji, both brothers are extremely friendly and professional. We booked our tour last minute and they were able to accomodate us.

They have strong village roots and helped us to understand the village culture and lifestyle.

We enjoyed Black buck spotting, weaving, pottery and block printing. It's an enriching experience, my 9 year old son enjoyed it. It's a unique experience and one should really take time and visit the village.

I had an absolutely wonderful experience on the Village Tour in Jodhpur. This tour gave me a real glimpse into the rural life of Rajasthan, far away from the city crowds. The warm hospitality of the local families, the simplicity of village life, and the chance to learn about traditional crafts like pottery and weaving made the journey unforgettable.

Our guide was very knowledgeable and explained everything about the Bishnoi culture, wildlife, and village traditions with so much passion. Meeting the locals, enjoying authentic Rajasthani food, and seeing the lifestyle of the villagers felt like stepping back in time.

This is not just a sightseeing tour ‚Äì it‚Äôs a cultural experience that connects you to the roots of Rajasthan. If you are visiting Jodhpur, I highly recommend taking this Village Safari / Bishnoi Village Tour. It was one of the highlights of my trip and deserves a perfect 5 stars! üåø‚ú®
Good , you can have one time experience by going there, but not too much animals to see. Black bucks are really beautiful. Overall good experience.

It was an excelent experience!! We recomend a lot the bishnoi village safari with Om, our guide, that shows everything. We have seen the traditional pottery making (and try it!), the rug weaving making, and also a great safari with jeep to see wildlife (blackbucks, deer, peacocks, etc.). We also have lunch with the Om's family and we enjoy it a lot!! It was our last stop after traveling two weeks in india, and we think that if you are visiting Jodhpur, you cannot miss it. Its a really great experience!!

Shambu was a great tour guide, very friendly and immediately made us feel at ease. We loved seeing the weaving and having a go at the pottery. Would absolutely recommend if you have a spare day in Jodhpur!
Was a very nice experience, we met local people and could try some stuff on our own. In the end we got some really good food and ate with the family - our tourguide was Om

We took the Bishnoi Village Safari along with a stay Pukhraj and it was truly one of the highlights of our visit to Jodhpur. The entire experience was well-organized, immersive, and filled with insights into the rich rural traditions of Rajasthan.

He shared stories and background about the Bishnoi community, their environmental values, and local customs, which really added depth to the experience. During the safari, we got to witness traditional block printing, durry (rug) weaving, and pottery. Watching artisans at work in their homes gave us a newfound appreciation for these age-old crafts. The durry weaving, in particular, stood out ‚Äî it was inspiring to see the painstaking effort and skill that goes into creating each vibrant piece.

One of the most memorable moments was spotting blackbucks in the wild. Seeing these graceful animals roaming freely in the open landscape was a rare and beautiful experience.

Further, the trek to the sunset point was a calm and enjoyable walk through the village surroundings. When we reached the top, we saw a beautiful view. The sky turned orange , and it was a quiet, peaceful moment that we‚Äôll always remember.

Above all, the hospitality of the owner and his family made the day feel extra special. They were kind, welcoming, and genuinely passionate about what they do. We left with not just photos and souvenirs, but a real sense of connection to the people and culture of the region

The enthralling village and Wildlife safari arranged by Pukhrajgarh Homestay.

We opted for a village tour and wildlife safari package in the afternoon, provided by the homestay which we thoroughly enjoyed with animal sightings like Nilgai, Blackbuck, Gazelle, Fox, Camel, dancing Peacocks and numerous Birds. The package also included visits to the Potters village, Weavers village etc.

Located in Umaid Public Park, Jodhpur, the Jodhpur Government Museum (Sardar Museum) was constructed in 1909 during the tenure of Maharaja Sardar Singh. The museum's exhibits feature: weapons and armor of Rajput warriors, paintings, manuscripts, and coins, and sculptures and artifacts from ancient Rajasthan.

The Sardar Government Museum, located in the heart of Jodhpur, Rajasthan, is a repository of the region's rich history and cultural heritage. Situated within the lush Umaid Bagh garden, the museum was commissioned by Maharaja Umed Singh in memory of his father, Maharaja Sardar Singh, and was formally opened to the public on March 17, 1936.

The museum's diverse collection includes:

Stone Sculptures: Approximately 400 pieces, showcasing intricate craftsmanship from various periods.

Miniature Paintings: Around 1,951 artworks, reflecting the finesse of Marwar's painting traditions.

Arms and Armour: A display of 178 weapons, providing insight into the martial history of the region.

Coins: An extensive collection of over 111,703 coins, illustrating the economic history and trade practices.

Miscellaneous Artifacts: Including terracotta artworks, inscriptions, textiles, and local crafts, each narrating a unique story of Jodhpur's past.

The museum is divided into several sections:

Archaeological Section: Featuring artifacts that trace the ancient history of the region.

Armory Section: Displaying a variety of weapons and armor used throughout different eras.

Art and Craft Section: Showcasing local arts, crafts, and textiles, highlighting the region's artistic heritage.

Historical Section: Presenting items that depict the historical evolution and significant events of Jodhpur.

Notably, the museum houses two Toranastambh (ornamental pillars) from Mandor, dating back to the Gupta era. One such pillar, belonging to the 4th century CE, depicts Krishna Leela, showcasing five activities of Krishna carved in low relief, such as lifting the Govardhana Parvat and stealing butter from his mother Yashoda. This pillar evidences the popularity of devotion to Krishna in the religious life of the people during that period.

For visitors planning a trip, the museum is located behind the Rajasthan High Court on Mali Street, Paota, Jodhpur, Rajasthan, 342006, India.  It's advisable to check the current opening hours and any entry fees before visiting.

reviews.reviewText:
The Mehrangarh Fort is one of the largest forts in the country and is known for its architectural beauty and historical significance. The fort houses several palaces, each with its own unique features and history.
Phool Mahal is an exquisite palace known for its intricate gold filigree work, paintings, and mirror work. It was created as a pleasure dome by Maharaja Abhaya Singh and was used for entertainment and festivities.

**A Majestic Marvel in the Blue City**

Mehrangarh Fort, towering 400 feet above Jodhpur, is not just a historical monument but a breathtaking symbol of Rajasthan‚Äôs grandeur. Built in the 15th century by Rao Jodha, the fort‚Äôs imposing walls and intricate architecture leave visitors spellbound.

### **Highlights:**
- **Architecture & Views:** The fort‚Äôs massive gates, ornate palaces (like Moti Mahal and Phool Mahal), and expansive courtyards showcase Rajput craftsmanship. The panoramic views of Jodhpur‚Äôs blue houses from the ramparts are unforgettable.
- **Museum:** One of the best in Rajasthan, it houses an exquisite collection of palanquins, arms, costumes, and royal artifacts. The audio guide (narrated by Shah Rukh Khan) adds a fascinating touch.
- **Cultural Experience:** Live folk music performances and the famous "Jodhpur RIFF" festival make the fort come alive with Rajasthani culture.
- **Chokelao Bagh & Caf√©:** A serene garden and rooftop caf√© offering delicious local snacks with a stunning fort backdrop.

### **Tips:**
- Visit early morning or late afternoon to avoid crowds and heat.
- Don‚Äôt miss the "Chamunda Devi Temple" and the thrilling "Jayapol" victory gate.
- Photography enthusiasts will love the endless photo opportunities.

**** Mehrangarh Fort is a must-visit for history buffs, architecture lovers, and anyone seeking a glimpse into Rajasthan‚Äôs royal past. Its sheer scale, beauty, and cultural richness make it one of India‚Äôs finest forts.

**** A mesmerizing journey through time‚Äîhighly recommended!

The Phool Mahal, or "Palace of Flowers," is one of the most exquisitely decorated and historically significant chambers within the Mehrangarh Fort in Jodhpur, Rajasthan.
Built in the 18th century by Maharaja Abhaya Singh, it served as a private audience hall and a space for royal entertainment and leisure. The name "Phool Mahal" itself suggests its vibrant beauty, as its interiors are designed to evoke the essence of a blooming flower.
Here's what makes it so remarkable:
* Opulent Decor: The palace is renowned for its extravagant decoration, featuring intricate frescoes, elaborate carvings, and richly colored wall paintings. The walls and ceilings are adorned with gold leaf work, often using gold brought from Gujarat, creating a lavish and regal ambiance.
* Artistic Excellence: You'll find a stunning display of Rajput and Mughal artistry, including detailed mirror work, delicate filigree, and vivid murals depicting royal life, traditional motifs, and even illustrations from the famous Raga Mala series (Indian classical music compositions). Portraits of Jodhpur's ancestors also grace the walls.
* Exclusive Use: Unlike some other parts of the fort, Phool Mahal was a private and exclusive chamber, primarily used by the Maharaja for private gatherings, entertainment by female dancers, and as a personal retreat. This exclusivity is reflected in its less accessible location within the fort.
* Historical Significance: It stands as a testament to the grandeur and artistic patronage of the Rathore rulers of Jodhpur, offering a glimpse into the lavish lifestyle of the royal family.
Today, Phool Mahal is a key part of the Mehrangarh Fort museum, allowing visitors to step back in time and admire its unique blend of architectural beauty and artistic splendor.

Nestled in the vibrant city of Jodhpur, the Gayatri Shaktipeeth Shree Chamunda Mata Temple is a divine sanctuary that leaves an indelible impression on the soul. Visiting this sacred haven is akin to embarking on a spiritual journey, immersing oneself in the divine aura that permeates every corner of this tranquil space.

Upon entering the temple premises, one is greeted by the resounding echoes of devotional chants, creating an atmosphere of serenity and devotion. The architecture of the temple is awe-inspiring, reflecting a harmonious blend of traditional design and intricate detailing. The vivid colors, ornate carvings, and sacred symbols adorning the temple walls contribute to its visual splendor.

Inside, the sanctum dedicated to Shree Chamunda Mata exudes an energy that is both powerful and peaceful. Devotees engage in heartfelt prayers, seeking solace and divine blessings. The temple's priests, with their deep knowledge and spiritual guidance, enhance the overall spiritual experience.

One cannot help but marvel at the panoramic views of Jodhpur that the temple offers. Positioned strategically, it provides a breathtaking vantage point, allowing visitors to absorb the beauty of the city while basking in the divine presence of the Chamunda Mata.

The temple's management ensures a well-maintained and clean environment, adding to the positive experience of devotees and visitors alike. Whether you're a devout worshiper or a curious traveler seeking cultural enrichment, the Gayatri Shaktipeeth Shree Chamunda Mata Temple promises an enriching and spiritually uplifting experience in the heart of Jodhpur.

The temple attracts pilgrims and tourists alike, seeking spiritual solace and the opportunity to witness the temple's intricate architecture and religious ceremonies.

sources.shortName: Top 15 Pre-wedding Shoot Locations In Jodhpur

sources.snippet: The bustling energy of Sardar Market, with its kaleidoscope of colors, aromatic spices, and intricate textiles, offers a wealth of photo opportunities. From vibrant street scenes to captivating portraits of the bustling market vendors, the market is a veritable treasure trove for documenting the essence of Jodhpur's vibrant culture.
sources.shortName: 10 Photo Spots at Jodhpur

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Sardar Market, located in Jodhpur, is a bustling and vibrant shopping destination reminiscent of Old Delhi's Chandini Chowk. The market offers a wide array of shops selling leather items, Rajasthani artifacts, and local souvenirs at affordable prices.
placeMetadata.address: 72WF+8G7, Nai Sarak Sardar Market, Cirdikot, Clock Tower Rd, Ghantaghar Market, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342001, India

reviews.reviewText: Clock Tower in Sardar Market is super cool! It's got this big clock and shops all around selling neat stuff like clothes and jewelry. Lots of tourists check it out, and there's tasty street food too. Tip: It's less crowded at night, and the lights make it look even better. Totally worth a visit!

Sardar Market, Girdikot is a very busy and colorful place in Jodhpur, Rajasthan. When I went there, I saw many small shops close to each other, selling all kinds of things like clothes, bangles, shoes, spices, and handicrafts. The market is built around a beautiful old clock tower, which looks very nice and is a famous landmark. Walking through the narrow streets of the market was a fun experience. I could smell the fresh spices and see bright-colored fabrics everywhere. The shopkeepers were friendly and called us to look at their goods. I also saw many tourists happily bargaining and buying souvenirs to take back home.

The market is perfect for people who love shopping and want to feel the real local life of Jodhpur. I found many traditional Rajasthani items like mojari shoes, leheriya dupattas, and silver jewelry. The prices were reasonable, and bargaining made shopping even more interesting. Street food stalls were also there, offering tasty snacks like samosas, kachoris, and sweets like gulab jamun. The area around the market was crowded but lively, and I enjoyed seeing the vibrant culture of the city. Sardar Market is truly a place where tradition and colors meet, and it gave me a very happy and memorable experience.

Visiting Sardar Market in Jodhpur is an immersive experience that showcases the vibrant culture and rich heritage of Rajasthan. This market, named after Sardar Singh, a former ruler of Jodhpur, is known for its narrow lanes and alleys lined with an array of shops selling a diverse range of goods, offering a unique retail therapy experience.

At Sardar Market, you can find a plethora of items. Some highlights include colorful Rajasthani textiles such as bandhani sarees and block-printed fabrics, and intricately designed jewelry made of silver and precious stones. This market is also a great place to shop for spices and herbs like vanilla, cardamom, and saffron, essential for many traditional Rajasthani dishes‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã.

The market's vibrant stalls are filled with traditional Rajasthani items, including textiles, handcrafted jewelry, leather goods, and spices. It's an excellent spot for purchasing Rajasthani fabrics. However, it's worth noting that the market can be quite crowded, and visitors are advised to be watchful while navigating through its narrow and congested lanes

Sardar Market is not just a shopping destination; it's a place that connects you with the past. The market's atmosphere, with its array of clothes, accessories, figurines, and spices, reflects the local life of Rajasthan. The market area is also close to the Clock Tower, or Ghanta Ghar, a 200-year-old structure that offers a panoramic view of the city

Sardar Market in Jodhpur is a vibrant gem, especially for those seeking authentic Rajasthani crafts and souvenirs. The stalls brim with colorful textiles, handcrafted jewelry, and delectable spices, all presented by local artisans. Don't miss the mesmerizing overhead view from the nearby clock tower (Ghanta Ghar) for a truly unforgettable perspective of the bustling market scene below.

Sardar Market, Cirdikot is one of the main markets in Jodhpur. Ghanta Ghar, Jodhpur is situated inside it. It has shops of traditional Rajasthani dresses and other traditional items. The market also has water arrangements for customers and passersby, which is good in Jodhpur heat. If in Jodhpur you must visit that market.

Vibrant, bustling, and lively‚Ä¶ this market is among the top we‚Äôve explored in India. Unlike some, it‚Äôs relatively well-maintained and it boasts a nice view of the fort from below. Plus, the clock tower adds a charming touch.

Sardar Market is a lively local market with a vibrant and chaotic affair. There are many narrow lanes leading form the main street and each lane is lined with lot of both tiny and big shops on both the sides.
Some of the most common items which can be purchased are tie and dye textiles, embroidered leather shoes, clay figurines, miniature camels and elephants, lacquer ware, antiques, carpets, puppets, marble inlay work and classic silver jewellery, etc.
A vivid insight in the typical indian culture! A crowded local market with various products being sold!

placeMetadata.name: The Blue House

sources.snippet: A member of my India Travel Tips group actually told me about this (thanks!) and after checking it out, I was hooked on one specific room: the Jhankar Temple Suite. It was SO cute in photos and looked exactly the same when I arrived. This place is great for ALL budgets.
sources.shortName: My Little Guide to Jodhpur, India‚Äôs Blue City: The Best Places for Photography and the Perfect Haveli in the Old City

placeMetadata.description: Stylish suites in a family-run guesthouse with rooftop dining & a library, plus free breakfast.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: "The Blue House" is a charming family-run guesthouse located in the old town area of Jodhpur, known for its stylish suites and rooftop dining. The blue-painted houses in the vicinity add to the allure of this historical area, offering visitors a glimpse into ancient times. One standout suite is the Jhankar Temple Suite, which exudes charm and comfort.
placeMetadata.address: Sumer-Bhawan, Moti Chowk, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342001, India

reviews.reviewText: We likely had the most expensive room, which was beautifully designed in a traditional style, featuring a small balcony and a stunning view of the fort right from the bed. A charming surprise awaits on the rooftop terrace‚Äîa resident hotel turtle, adding a unique touch to the stay. The location is excellent, close to the train station and major attractions. The staff is helpful, and overall, it's a wonderful place that I highly recommend.

1.Rooms are near and clean
2. View of Mehrangarh fort from room itself.
3. Seating area on terrace for dinning etc.
4. Staff and owner both are very well behaved.

Had a very warm welcome, the owners are such lovely people and the turtle on the balcony was just awesome.
Rooms were clean, though I‚Äôd prefer a different kind of blanket on the bed. It was the kind you question if it is cleaned after every stay. We came prepared, so we solved it with a sheet underneath it.
The view of the fort from our room was awesome, we kept the curtains open so when we woke up we could see the fort from the bed.
Overall a very cosy and authentic vibe. Would definitely recommend.

Overall when you factor in the warmth of the family, the heavenly food and stunning views of the massive Fort from the rooftop deck this is truly a 5 star House not a Hotel. Immersive yourself in India.

I took a room here and I liked it very much and it feels like one's own home here and it is very beautiful, from here one can see the Mahrangar fort and the room was also very beautiful and everything it was good

I spent a wonderful time in the "Blue house Guesthouse". I had a lovely stay in this gorgeous place. The location is perfect: in the old city, close to all the main monuments of Jodhpur. My room was clean and nicely decorated. Moreover, I enjoyed the stunning view on the fort of Jodhpur. The family who owns the place is both professional and friendly. I had an amazing time thanks to their warm welcome.
For sure, I will come back and I highly recommend this place.

Very badly maintained. No lift, no heed to any grievances that may arise out of the nearly absent customer service. Rooms are noisy, no temperature control, the beds are old and make loud sounds when you even slightly move. The owners are intrusive and very greedy.

They will take bookings for their more expensive hotel (Jhankaar which is nearby) and send you to this lodge of a home stay citing last-minute emergencies and sell those rooms to foreigners on even higher tariffs. Not at all, reliable.

Indians should particularly stay away from this property as they prioritise foreigners for their good rooms. I feel for the overseas tourists who don‚Äôt understand the bare minimum standards followed in the hospitality industry in India. They come with minimum expectations and these guys sell them such bad rooms at 5-6 times the price.

We won‚Äôt go to this place again even if they paid us to live here. We can‚Äôt believe we paid for this house. A total waste of our hard earned money.

If you are expecting all kind of facilities which normally a good hotel provides, then this hotel is not for you. We were residing here last week. On our prior request, we were provided a top floor room with a view of Mehrangarh Fort from room as well as balcony. This was the only good part of this hotel. Actually this is more an ancient old home than a than a hotel. Room and washroom was not bad. But two horrible things of this hotel was...1) no lift was available, you have to go up by stairs only, not possible for aged people, 2) We faced load-shedding i.e power cut for sometimes, but no inverter was there. Although they provide us hot water on our demand during power cut period, but they provide it little late which causes us late starting of our sightseeing journey for Jodhpur. Not fully satisfied with their service.

placeMetadata.name: Stepwell Caf√©

sources.snippet: The best view of Jhalara is from the Step Well Cafe which is operated by the same company that owns the luxurious RAAS hotel. The menu here is limited and the food honestly wasn‚Äôt that great. However the ambiance is incredible, each floor is a bit different with a restaurant area at the first level, a more lounge-like space on the second, and a rooftop terrace complete with throw pillows and whimsical curtains that dance in the wind.
sources.shortName: The Ultimate Jodhpur Instagram Guide

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Tucked away in the JDH Project, Stepwell Caf√© is a delightful retreat that invites visitors to experience Jodhpur's vibrant heritage while savoring a delicious cappuccino. The caf√© boasts walls adorned with vintage photographs that celebrate Rajasthan's royal history, creating an ambiance steeped in nostalgia. Offering a unique blend of Indo-European cuisine, it fills an essential niche in the local dining scene with its comforting and satisfying dishes.
placeMetadata.address: Tunwarji Ka, Jhalra Makrana Mohalla, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342001, India

reviews.reviewText: A cozy spot with a beautiful view of the stepwell. The menu is limited, but well-curated, making it a great place to relax and enjoy a quick bite.

Really beautiful space and decor overlooking the stepwell and a view from the 3rd level to Menagragh Fort. The food was good quality but the service was almost non existent - the waiters seemed to begrudge having to take orders from the few customers. Service in India tends to be pretty relaxed but this was more than relaxed!

The cafe is made very asthetically. There is a main air conditioned area then there is a semi open place and then the rooftop. I was surprised to see they served beer on tap and also a full blpwn decently priced alcohol menu. I got both the tap beers. Honestly they werent worth 535 each after seeing how the manager had to fill it. It was so frothy something was up with the machine system. It was in April end and it was not the best time I understand. 10/10 for the place and vibe and stuff but not so much for the overpriced beer. I think I was way too excited to just have found hefe on tap on a random one day trip to Jodhpur. We didnt discover this cafe on our last visit to RAAS hotel for a meal. The area around is lovely and worth a visit just on a good time.

The walk to the place is good. The step well view is exhilarating. We saw boys swimming in the heat jumping from different heights. Fun experience wish the beer was cheaper.

Food was average.
Roof-top restaurant had really good feels... Especially at night.
The view from the top, as well as the first floor restaurant is good.
Good as a once- in-a-while visiting place.

I visited Step Well Caf√© after seeing it on Instagram, and it really does have stunning views of Toorji ka Jhalra. üåä‚ú® The caf√© is tucked inside the narrow lanes, just about a 5-minute walk from Clock Tower, and the entrance itself is very aesthetic with a lovely blue street wall.

It‚Äôs a small caf√© with cozy seating, but what makes it special is the calm and serene view of the stepwell. There‚Äôs also a rooftop sitting area where you can relax and enjoy the vibe, and you can even head directly down to the stepwell from here.

I tried their pasta and coffee, and both were delicious. üçù‚òï The combination of good food and a beautiful view made it a memorable stop during my Jodhpur trip.

Overall: a charming little spot with aesthetic vibes, tasty food, and a unique view of Toorji ka Jhalra ‚Äî definitely worth a visit!

View is great but place is not set up well esp the floor with air conditioning - there is no seating with good view and less disturbance from the team. It seems like an old establishment famous amongst foreign tourists for its elite set-up (pictures and letters of British officers and royal family etc). Can be easily skipped from the list.

The cafe is pretty aesthetic and has a good vibe. Good for sunsets, will even get a view of mehrangarh from the terrace.

However, cannot say the same for the food. We found the food overpriced and undelivered. We ordered lamb kababs which were good. The crispy chicken and garden pizza were okayish. The white sauce fusilli was bland.

The portions are questionable. I think it could have been better.

Loved the view from the rooftop into the well. It was lots of fun seeing the teens jump into the well.
We had 4 starters and shared it between 2, which was enough (for us at least). They were pretty good, but lacked a bit the Indian spice we asked for. We also shared a beer and did not try the cocktails.

placeMetadata.name: Gypsy Vegetarian Restaurant

sources.snippet: If you only take my advice for one meal in Jodhpur let it be to devour a thali at the upstairs dining hall at Gypsy. Please send me a picture when you go so I can cry somber tears of longing as this is easily one of my favorite meals in the world. Thali is the best way to sample a variety of Indian foods and flavors!.
sources.shortName: The Ultimate Jodhpur Instagram Guide

placeMetadata.description: Popular, laid-back restaurant serving a menu of Rajasthani cuisine, especially thalis.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Gypsy Vegetarian Restaurant, located in a bustling market in Jodhpur, is renowned for its extensive Rajasthani thalis. The restaurant offers a lavish spread of local cuisine with true Rajasthani fare, including dishes like dal-bati, lal mass, churma, gatte ki sabzi, and more. Visitors can expect superb food, friendly service, and a cozy atmosphere at this popular eatery.
placeMetadata.address: P No, 689, 9th C Rd, Sardarpura, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342003, India

reviews.reviewText:
Amazing quality and variety of food.
Great hospitality and service.
This thali covers everything you aspire to eat in Rajasthan.
This is one of the best Thali I ate.

They really appreciate people not leaving food behind(finishing the whole meal, however it is one's requirement)

Lively, clean and welcoming vibe of good ol' Gypsy. I had heard about this place from friends and my wife, and it was every bit what I had imagined and more, in a good way. It's one of those dependable food joints or restaurants that you have in every city. Pure vegetarian food made with desi ghee and served with a smile. Staff is extremely courteous and well trained, and all the food preparations are made with the most fresh ingredients always. What really stood apart for me was their very good hygiene standards. Not very common in old restaurants to see absolutely clean washrooms and wash basin area. They have a smaller joint on the ground floor with parking for a couple of cars, and then a big hall upstairs for proper dining. Highly recommended for people craving for some authentic Rajasthani vegetarian cuisine.

The food is amazing if your love to eat unlimited they have options of thali but you want normal limted food they options too with limted price the quantity and quality was too good but order roti carefully there roti is too big and taste was good

Must try item is -dal bati ,rajasthani thali and gujrati thali mix ,raj kachori,ker sangri

Gypsy Vegetarian Restaurant in Jodhpur is one of the best places for anyone looking to experience authentic Indian vegetarian cuisine in a clean, welcoming family-friendly environment. I recently visited the restaurant and tried their famous Dal Baati‚Äîand I must say, it was absolutely delicious! The taste was rich, traditional, and perfectly spiced. The baatis were crispy yet soft inside, and the dal was full of flavor with a comforting home-style touch.The entire thali they serve is very satisfying and gives you a true taste of Rajasthani culture. The portion sizes are generous, and every item on the plate‚Äîfrom churma to gatte ki sabzi‚Äîwas fresh and well-prepared. The service was fast and polite, and the staff was attentive and friendly, always ready to explain the dishes to tourists or first-time visitors.The restaurant itself is neat and well-organized, with a good ambiance that makes it a great place for families and groups. It‚Äôs a pure vegetarian restaurant, so it's ideal for those who follow a veg diet or want to enjoy Indian meals without worrying about non-veg options. They also maintain good hygiene, which is always a plus point.
Gypsy truly gives you value for money and a satisfying dining experience. Whether you're a local or a tourist exploring Jodhpur, I highly recommend visiting Gypsy at least once for their amazing food and warm hospitality. I would definitely return again just for that unforgettable dal baati!

Tried a Gypsy thali and puri with gatte ki sabji.

The puri and the rest of the thali were delicious!

The gatte ki sabji was a bit on the sweeter side for my taste, but overall, it was a good meal! üòä

Stepping into Gypsy Vegetarian Restaurant in Sardarpura, Jodhpur, feels like uncovering a local culinary treasure. Tucked away in a vibrant part of the city, easily accessible yet offering a pleasant escape from the bustling streets, this place truly lives up to its reputation. The ambiance is warm and welcoming, perfectly setting the stage for what promises to be an authentic Rajasthani dining experience.

My recent visit was centered around their legendary Rajasthani Thali, and let me tell you, it was an absolute feast for the senses. The sheer scale of it ‚Äì a grand spread boasting an incredible **33 different items** ‚Äì was breathtaking. From the moment the thali arrived, laden with a kaleidoscope of colors and aromas, I knew I was in for something special.

Every single dish on that platter was a testament to the rich culinary heritage of Rajasthan. The daals were perfectly spiced, the vegetable preparations offered a delightful variety of textures and flavors, and the rotis and puris were served fresh and hot. The famous Gatte ki Sabzi was rich and flavorful, and the churma was decadently sweet, providing a perfect balance to the savory elements. What truly stood out was the **consistently delicious and authentic taste** across all items; nothing felt out of place or generic. Each bite was a delightful discovery, showcasing the subtle complexities of traditional spices and cooking methods.

It‚Äôs more than just a meal; it‚Äôs an immersive cultural experience. For anyone visiting Jodhpur and looking to truly savor the essence of Rajasthani vegetarian cuisine, Gypsy Vegetarian Restaurant is an absolute must-visit. You‚Äôll leave feeling incredibly satisfied and with a profound appreciation for the flavors of the Blue City.
Very nice authentic Jodhpuri food. The thali is highly recommended. The Choorma was amazing. The staff are very respectful and discourage food wastage.

Food Taste- very average taste. Nothing was up to the mark and we ordered variety (curry, dal, rice, roti, chat, salad)

Food quantity- very less. I have attached picture/video of full plate rice and curry

Food price- very high. For the quality of food they give. The prices are at least 50 percent premium.

Thoroughly disappointed in the food. Don‚Äôt know why there is so much hype of this place.

placeMetadata.name: Shandar Sweet Home

sources.shortName: The Ultimate Jodhpur Instagram Guide

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Shandar Sweet Home, located near the Jodhpur Railway Station, is a must-visit for foodies looking to experience traditional Rajasthani cuisine. One of its unique dishes is the Gulab Jamun ki Sabzi, where the beloved sweet treat is transformed into a savory delight by being deep-fried and served in a rich tomato and cashew nut gravy.
placeMetadata.address: Jalori Bari Rd, Medical Market, Opposite M.G. Hospital, Jalori Gate, Ratanada, Barli, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342001, India

reviews.reviewText:
An amazing restaurant outside the city centre, I highly recommend Shandar as the place to eat in Jhodpur.

At around ‚Çπ220 for most dishes, the price-quality ratio is superb. The curries are rich in taste and the chapatis are freshly made.

Though certainly catered more towards locals, the staff were both kind and helpful.

Food Review: Overhyped & Pricey, with a Few Hits and Misses

Tried this place after seeing it all over social media, but honestly, it didn‚Äôt live up to the hype created by food bloggers.

The veg dishes tasted good ‚Äî well-cooked and flavourful ‚Äî but nothing extraordinary that justifies the buzz. Portion sizes were quite small for the price, making it feel overpriced, especially if you‚Äôre expecting a proper filling meal.

The biggest disappointment was the Kabuli. It lacked flavor, was dry, and didn't have the rich taste you‚Äôd normally expect from a dish that‚Äôs usually packed with spices and aroma.

The best Rajasthani Food I‚Äôve ever tried. Best gulab jamun ki subzi, dal fry, gatte ki subzi and to die for lehsun ki chutney. Don‚Äôt visit this place if you don‚Äôt like Ghee. Also, the lassi, unarguably the best in Rajasthan I‚Äôve had (I‚Äôve tried from all the recommended places in the state). You cannot miss this spot.

Bahut Shandar, Bahut Shandar!

My friends in Jodhpur highly recommended this place for lunch and dinner. We went there for lunch, and honestly, at first glance, we thought we had come to the wrong place, the restaurant is not fancy, has a too old school vibe, and is a bit congested.

But once the food arrived, everything changed. We had Dal Fry, Malai Kofta, Masala Papad, and ended with Fruit Cream and Meva Cream.

The Dal Fry and Meva Cream are absolute must-tries! The taste more than makes up for the simple ambience.

Authentic Rajasthani Taste!
Shandar Sweet Home is a must-visit place if you're in Jodhpur and want to try delicious local Rajasthani food. Their served sabji with ghee just like home. The gatte ki sabzi, ker sangri, and lachha paratha are also worth trying.

The restaurant is simple and traditional in its setting, but the food speaks for itself. It's a no-frills place, but hygienic and well-maintained. Service is quick, and the staff is polite.

Recommend it for an authentic veg Rajasthani meal at a reasonable price!

Founded by late Bhati ji this place is located in the heart of city inside jalori gate.
Unlike typical restaurant this place is not so spacious yet popular for it's authentic taste.
I tried dal it was quite good 10/10
But paneer was not so good 7/10

The only special part is they cook every meal in sudh desi ghee. The staff is very friendly and believes in hospitality.

Utensils can be improved over the time.
Overall a good experience to try.

I recently visited Shandar Sweet Home and had the pleasure of trying their unique Gulab Jamun Sabji and Kabuli Pulao. The taste was absolutely delightful, and the food was bursting with flavors. The ambiance of the place was very nice, adding to the overall experience. I highly recommend this place to anyone who loves delicious and unique food. A must-visit!

While the food is yummy be prepared to wait for your turn! You will have people hovering around your table, waiting for you to get up.

But the wait will be worth it!

Fastest service üëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèª

placeMetadata.name: Sheesh Mahal

sources.snippet: The Sheesh Mahal in the Mehrangarh Fort of Jodhpur, known as the Glass Palace of Jodhpur, is a marvellous piece of historic architecture is decked from ceiling to floor with fanciful mirror work. The ceilings and floors are inlaid with mirrors, earning the room the title of Hall of Mirrors. It is said to be the bedchamber of Maharaja Ajit Singh between the 17th and 18th centuries.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to visit in Jodhpur | Top Tourist Attractions

placeMetadata.description: Decorative mirror palace inside the sprawling 15th-century hilltop Mehrangarh fortress.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Sheesh Palace is an attraction located within the expansive Mehrangarh fortress, perched on a hilltop and built during the 15th century. The palace boasts a multitude of decorative mirrors that adorn its walls, creating an enchanting visual experience for visitors. This museum offers a unique glimpse into the history and architecture of ancient India while also showcasing intricate artwork and design elements.
placeMetadata.address: 72X9+MQR, Mehrangarh Ft Rd, Sodagaran Mohalla, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342001, India

reviews.reviewText: The Sheesh Mahal, or "Glass Palace," is a captivating chamber within Jodhpur's Mehrangarh Fort, exemplifying the opulence of royal Rajput architecture. This hall is adorned from floor to ceiling with intricate mirror work, creating a dazzling effect that enchants visitors.

The Sheesh Mahal (Hall of Mirrors) in Mehrangarh Fort, Jodhpur, Rajasthan, is an incredibly beautiful and opulent chamber. It stands as a prime example of Rajput architecture and grandeur.
Constructed during the reign of Maharaja Ajit Singh (1678-1724), this room is adorned with shimmering mirrors and colored glass pieces. The walls and ceilings are covered in intricate patterns and designs that glisten in the light. These mirrors were strategically placed to reflect both natural and artificial light (such as oil lamps), illuminating the entire room and creating a magical and expansive effect. Even the ceilings feature mirrors that give the illusion of a starry night. This palace symbolizes the royal lifestyle and the artistic excellence of the Rajput rulers.

One of the most beautiful and most and most visited palace in Mehrangarh Fort which houses several palaces, one of them is Kanch Mahal known for its stunning stained glass windows that depict various religious motifs and figures. The palace is a unique blend of Rajput and Mughal architectural styles and is a testament to the artistic prowess of the craftsmen of that era.
There is also a Sheesh Mahal in this palace which you will like very much. If you come inside this palace to see the Sheesh Mahal, then you must also see the Sheesh Mahal before leaving.

Sheesh Palace in Mehrangarh Fort is nothing short of a masterpiece! This stunning jewel of Rajasthan‚Äôs royal heritage dazzles with its intricate mirror work, where every surface seems to sparkle and come alive with reflections. The craftsmanship is extraordinary, with delicate carvings and vibrant colors creating an atmosphere of opulence and wonder.

Walking through the Sheesh Mahal feels like stepping into a fairy tale. The way the light dances off the mirrors is simply mesmerizing, and the palace‚Äôs design showcases the incredible artistic talents of the era. The guided tour adds to the experience, offering rich insights into the history and significance of this regal space.

Situated within the magnificent Mehrangarh Fort, the views surrounding the Sheesh Palace are breathtaking, offering sweeping vistas of the Blue City of Jodhpur. Despite the popularity of the site, the palace maintains a sense of tranquility that allows you to fully immerse yourself in its beauty.

If you‚Äôre visiting Jodhpur, the Sheesh Palace is an absolute must-see. It‚Äôs a testament to the grandeur of Rajasthan‚Äôs past and a highlight of any trip to this historic region. Five stars for a truly magical experience!
Best place in the fort ever and very good architectural design

Beautiful! The Sheesh Palace is a gem within the fort. The walls and ceilings are intricately decorated with mirrors and glass, reflecting light beautifully. Walking on the richly designed floor, you feel the grandeur of the Maharaja era. The architecture is simply stunning. A must-visit for anyone exploring Jodhpur!
Pretty average typical fort. You can definitely visit better Forts elsewhere. But for the price it's decent.

placeMetadata.name: Shahi Samosa Arora Namkeen

Don‚Äôt miss out on having breakfast at the world famous Omelette Shop just north of the clock tower. No trip to Jodhpur would be complete without indulging in ghee-covered delicacies at Shandar Sweet Home.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: When in Jodhpur, a visit to Shahi Samosa Arora Namkeen is an absolute must for any food lover. This iconic street food spot pays homage to the city's royal heritage with its delectable samosas, which are inspired by the majestic forts of Jodhpur. The shahi samosa is not just your average snack; it boasts a rich filling of potatoes, onions, and spices complemented by cashews and nuts that elevate its flavor profile to something truly regal.
