reviews.reviewText:
I have never seen such a confident Samosa seller. They sell Samosa without Chatni or Sauce. Samosa is really tasty and crispy in nature. Along with Samosa u can try Mirchi bada and Pyaz Kachori. It is a super crowded place in market.
They also serve Lassi which haven't tried. They 4 to 5 variants in lassi starting from Rs. 40.
Samosa and Mirchi Bada costs Rs. 25 each

Pl be careful of ur luggage and belongings as place is with lotnof rush and kiosk.

Shahi Samosa, situated near the Clock Tower in Jodhpur, is a renowned spot for street food enthusiasts. The establishment is famed for its crispy samosas, generously filled with a flavorful mixture of potatoes and spices. Each samosa is priced at approximately ‚Çπ25, offering excellent value for money.

In addition to their signature samosas, Shahi Samosa offers a variety of other snacks, including Mirchi Vada and Kachori, each delivering a burst of authentic Rajasthani flavors. The stall's location near the bustling old town market makes it a convenient stop for both locals and tourists.

While the stall is often crowded, service is swift, ensuring that patrons don't have to wait long to enjoy their treats. However, it's worth noting that some customers have reported occasional mix-ups in orders, so it's advisable to check your items before leaving.
Must visit & try there samosa they are literally amazing in taste and there lassi as well üëåüëåüëå

This outlet is near Clock Tower. It is located in a bustling local market. Samosa offered here is crisp and tasty. Filling of samosa has a tinge of lemon which makes it unique. Mirchi Bada and Pyaj Kachori is also very famous here. Kachori too is crisp and tasty. After eating these namkeens you can relish lassi which is thick and nicely sweet. You have to stand and eat here or pack it for home.

Shahi Samosa in Jodhpur is very famous and always crowded for their samosa and mirchi vada. But honestly, as a Gujarati, I didn‚Äôt enjoy it much. The samosa has salty masala stuffing without chutney, and instead they serve it with bread, which felt unusual for me. Personally, I didn‚Äôt like the taste, but you‚Äôll still see a big crowd here as it‚Äôs a popular local spot.

I visited Shahi Samosa Arora Namkeen store and tried their Samosa, Aloo Tikki Chaat, and Palak Papdi Chaat. All the items were absolutely delicious, with rich flavors and great quality. A fantastic spot for anyone who loves tasty snacks. Highly recommended!
They serve one of the best samosas I‚Äôve ever tasted! Crispy on the outside and perfectly spiced filling inside. It‚Äôs a small place but packs a huge flavor punch. A local favorite for sure...

Shahi Samosa in Jodhpur is a MUST!

Their samosas and mirchi vadas are next-level delicious, and even better than Surya Namkeen. üòã

placeMetadata.name: The Curry's

sources.snippet: Non-guests are welcome to dine at the beautiful cafe which has both indoor and outdoor seating in an idyllic setting. The hostel also organizes walking tours and cooking classes!
sources.shortName: The Ultimate Jodhpur Instagram Guide

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Located in Makarana Mohalla, just behind Jodhpur's Clock Tower, The Currys Restaurant offers a diverse culinary experience with an inviting ambiance. With an open terrace, it provides the perfect setting to savor dishes like Chicken Curry, Kadhai Paneer, Biryani, and various Indian curries. Renowned for its authentic Rajasthani breakfast, this restaurant also boasts a stylish interior and professional service.
placeMetadata.address: Makrana Mohalla, near Tunwarji Ka, Jhalra, Rajasthan 342001, India

reviews.reviewText:
Awesome atmosphere with live Rajasthani music, fort view, beautiful ambience, Just love the vibes.
Tasty food, must try Rajasthani chicken.
Food is little costly but worth with live music and good taste.
Service is good.
Overall well spent evening.

I‚Äôve traveled to a number of Hostels in India and the Curry‚Äôs Rooftop is really worth the prices and earns its place in the central district of the Blue City.

The food was outstanding, the service was first class. Jaswart was a brilliant manager and took care of us every step of the way along with the team.

Even if you aren‚Äôt staying at Zostel it‚Äôs so worth a dinner there. Great Sunrise and Sunset spot too.
Awesome atmosphere with Rajasthani music, Mehrangarh fort view, and beautiful ambience. Jaswant bhaiya is very chill person.

Live performance from local artist.
Great ambiance.
Food was awesome too. Tried traditional Rajasthani food.

Everything from the food to the atmosphere was fantastic! The Laal Maas was absolutely delicious and perfectly cooked. This rooftop restaurant features a caf√© facing the fort and is built on Zostel. The experience was enhanced by live folk singers, making it even more memorable.

best place to hangout in evening. beautiful view of mehrangarh fort. everything is in blue color. best location and ambience. best vibes. food is average though. if you want to relax and enjoy then you must go to this place. at night, there is also some local artists perform local songs. vibe is 10/10.

This place was great. Food was tasty, service was nice, view is great, and to top it off there was live music !! Our server Jaswat was very kind and always made sure we were okay and provided excellent service. I would recommend to come here.

Great place to relax at the end of the day in Jodhpur. Nice music, great service, great food, very reasonable prices. And oh important! They have veg and non-veg options. I had a very tasty tandoori chicken with a couple of beers!

placeMetadata.name: Caf√© Royale ClockTower

sources.snippet: Right behind the vintage sari market is one of my favorite cafes in Jodhpur, Caf√© Royale, it is also one of the only places in town to get a soy milk chai tea, and they even do an iced rendition!
sources.shortName: The Ultimate Jodhpur Instagram Guide

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled in the heart of Jodhpur, Caf√© Royale ClockTower is a true gem for coffee lovers and food enthusiasts alike. This elegant caf√© boasts a sophisticated ambiance that invites you to unwind while savoring expertly crafted specialty coffees and delightful pastries. Its prime location near the iconic Clock Tower offers stunning views, making it an ideal spot to relax and indulge in delicious snacks alongside your favorite beverage. The friendly staff adds a personal touch, engaging with guests to enhance their experience.
placeMetadata.address: Ghantaghar Market, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342001, India

reviews.reviewText:
Had a great breakfast with really warm Hosts. The place opens early and is very small, but has a warm and cozy vibe. The food is fresh and the coffee is one of the best in jodhpur. They make good sandwiches and the buns are recommended.

Keep up the good work....

Kudos!

We had a Great time at Cafe Royale it was amazing experience to visit here. The owner of cafe very friendly she is so nice of us. We order sandwich and coffee so tasty and worth it.
Location of cafe amazing with great Clock Tower.
Highly recommend

At first glance I was wondering why this place was #1 on Trip Advisor. Turns out I would come to this place every day while I was in Jodhpur, and now I definitely see why.

The location is very central - right near the infamous clock tower. It is a small venue, but there is both indoor and outdoor seating and it's overall a very cozy place.

First thing to note - the coffee. This is hands down the best place for someone to go if they value excellent brewed coffee (and with a range of choices!). Also, their iced teas and ice chai are scrumptious.

As for the food, there is a small, mostly snack-style menu with a lot of grilled sandwiches and some Indian dishes too. The sandwiches and also the chat are INCREDIBLE if you're after a quick bite (or to share plates between people).

The business is family owned, and the brothers that run the cafe are always so nice and helpful. They offer cooking classes (which I also did), run by the mother, and for 750 rupees for a 4 hour private class learning so many dishes, it was a very enjoyable experience. Could not recommend this place enough!

Fantastic, relaxed place above the busy square. Really friendly people running the place, you can see them making time to chat to people. Great selection of sandwiches and snacks and really good coffee, it made the perfect, peaceful pitstop after a day of walking around.

Center stage view of the clock tower's clothing and spice market. The owners are extremely friendly and honest, which was extremely refreshing after being caught in tourist traps. There is shade to sit in, with deck sets that follow the building looking onto the tower's face.
The best part of the experience was definitely the coffee. It was not burnt nor luke warm like most coffee shops. Our cappuccino and americano were absolutely delicious. A must when wanting to relax amidst a busy Jodhpur experience.

Great lil cafe that we found via TA and ended coming back 4 times during our stay. It‚Äôs very small though they have additional seating around the corner. Good place to stop and chill when it‚Äôs really hot, they serve great drinks, get the iced chai masala and mint and lemon drink!! Their cheese and tomato toaster was also delicious. The best thing about this place are he owners, they‚Äôre so lovely to chat to especially the mother. We loved just coming as the vibe was so chilled.

They are opening up a 2nd place very soon which will have a proper kitchen and bathroom too! If I ever come back I‚Äôll def visit this place again.
Located right next to Ghanta Ghar, small quaint cafe run by beautiful and very hospitable (mom n son). Food was good and services were good too.
This is very cool palce to hangout and have some snacks. Owners are very friendly and polite. It's nothing fancy but a beautiful place to eat at if you just need a tea/coffee break.

placeMetadata.name: Omelette Shop

sources.snippet: Don‚Äôt miss out on having breakfast at the world famous Omelette Shop just north of the clock tower. No trip to Jodhpur would be complete without indulging in ghee-covered delicacies at Shandar Sweet Home.
sources.shortName: The Ultimate Jodhpur Instagram Guide

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Located just north of the Clock Tower in Jodhpur, the Omelette Shop is a popular roadside food joint offering a variety of delicious omelets and other fast foods. The owner, who has been working there since 1972, ensures that customers are treated to friendly service and affordable, mouthwatering dishes. Visitors can enjoy watching their omelettes being prepared while taking in the colorful market scene.
placeMetadata.address: 72WF+9HP, Pal Haveli, Ghantaghar, Sri Ganganagar, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342001, India

reviews.reviewText: The owner said he has been working here since 1972 and now his son does most of the work. He was nice and friendly. The food was delicious, cheap and served fast - such a contrast to the overpriced touristic restaurants in town. You can watch your omelette being prepared and they have cold diet coke, unlike many restaurants. Nice spot for people-watching and photography - the market is colorful.

Worst omelette i ever had in my life. I tried their so called famous ‚ÄòMicheal Baba & ‚ÄòMasala creamy cheese‚Äô Omellette. It was burnt, not tasty at all, very bad, unhygienic. Though we couldn‚Äôt complain the owner. I tried many other famous outlets of Jodhpur, all were worth trying, don‚Äôt know why this omellete shop is famous. Should avoid trying this for sure.

I tried their Masala creamy omelette. It was good. The next day I tried their Michael baba omelette and Spanish omelette, to be true I didn't understand the hype for that omelette; it tasted mid, no flavours, only potatoes.
Although the owner's behaviour was friendly and polite he should think to improve the surroundings of the place and to buy new sitting arrangements.
Please note- the place doesn't open till 10:30 am
Best omelette ever! Had to come back twice! Creamy masala omelette is the way to go. Very reasonable prices and the man running it is great

A must-try if you're in Jodhpur! A humble stall selling a variety of egg dishes. Tried the spanish omelette and guava juice. Was seasoned beautifully w salt and pepper. The shop has a long history going back to the 1970s and has been here for decades.Very few seating options available.

There are many types of omelettes here but the ones I tried did not taste good to me. I felt that this is an ordinary omelet which I can make at home. Maybe I can make it better than this. I did not find any good taste here, so you can go and try it!
Serving, fatastic very cheap food, since 1976 I can't recommend this place enough. Shyam, the owner is a lovely man and very helpful with any questions to do with Jodhpur

Ya like i visited this place accidently and clicked some photos
I didnt dine here as i am pure vegetarian
I was here so thought click some photos and post it

ops.insert: Elaborately carved white marble funerary monument built in 1899 to honor Maharaja Jaswant Singh II.
Scenic, landscaped grounds featuring tomblike monuments, a temple, statues & the ruins of Mandore.
Popular for photos, this restored 18th-century stepwell features intricate sandstone carvings.
Built circa 1460, one of India's largest forts offers a lift & galleries, plus guided tours & shops.
Built circa 1460, one of India's largest forts offers a lift & galleries, plus guided tours & shops.
Luxurious rooms & suites, some with balconies, in an ornate hotel with international restaurants.
Desert park with distinctive rock formations, many native plants & an interpretive center.
Created in the 19th century, this artificial lake offers boating, birdwatching & sunset views.
A palace & tree-filled gardens overlook this lake created in 1159 AD, now a popular picnic spot.
Bustling city square known for its lively marketplace & soaring 19th-century clocktower.
Luxurious rooms & suites, some with balconies, in an ornate hotel with international restaurants.
Exhibits on military history, ancient culture & artworks are showcased in a 1909 brick building.
Spacious, brightly lit eatery offering multicuisine fare in a cheerful atmosphere.
Large Hindu temple with dramatic views of Jodhpur, with a serene vibe, except on festival days.
Popular, laid-back restaurant serving a menu of Rajasthani cuisine, especially thalis.
Decorative mirror palace inside the sprawling 15th-century hilltop Mehrangarh fortress.
Stylish suites in a family-run guesthouse with rooftop dining & a library, plus free breakfast.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we‚Äôre always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Jodhpur, often referred to as the 'Blue City', is a vibrant tapestry of history, culture, and stunning architecture that beckons photographers and travelers alike. With its iconic blue-painted houses, majestic forts, and bustling markets, every corner of this city offers a unique backdrop for capturing unforgettable moments. From the towering Mehrangarh Fort that stands sentinel over the city to the serene beauty of Bal Samand Lake, Jodhpur is a photographer's dream come true.

As you wander through the narrow lanes of the old town, you'll discover hidden gems like the intricately carved Toorji Ka Jhalra Bavdi and the charming Blue House, each telling their own story through their stunning visuals. Whether you're an amateur snapping photos on your phone or a seasoned photographer with a professional camera, Jodhpur's rich colors and textures provide endless opportunities for creativity. So grab your camera and get ready to explore the best photo spots that this enchanting city has to offer!
